topics.body:
"@Miyo":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549e824063687264e1770700#post_549e824063687264e1770700
Don't blame yourself.

If he killed himself cause of depression or such that shit is *way* harder to overcome than most people believe it is.  Even if he got help chances are it would have turned out the same cause speaking from experience most psychologists fall into two categories when it comes to helping those with suicidal thoughts: the crams down fifty different types of medication till they can't think straight but are so doped up that everyone thinks the underlying problem is fixed kind; or the generic "hang in there kitty" posters plastered on the walls kind.

To use an analogy think of trying to overcome suicidal thoughts and such as someone trying to run a marathon race with a 500lb weight roped to them.  Psychologists and most "professionals" are like a coach that keeps whistling at you believing you can you do it.  The people that don't understand how hard it is like a person that sees the 500lb weight and thinks there's no reason why it should slow them down.  Helping someone with depression takes multiple people all dragging that weight together to help them across the finish line.

"When you can’t run, you crawl, and when you can’t crawl, when you can’t do that you find someone to carry you."
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
I knew him too
I couldn't do anything because I only knew him online.
Apparently his phone broke and I was unable to get into contact with him....
I feel so guilty.
I wish I could have stopped him.
I loved him. He was one of my best friends and I have very few, always there for me and we talked a lot.
He made me happy and meant the world to me.
When he disappeared I had no idea he killed himself until now. 
I was depressed just at his disappearance but now I am even more so because I am in disbelief and guilt. I couldnt do anything...
I do t know how to react right now I am so shocked
topics.author: 534345d36368727047b40100

topics.body:
No 
I feel so broken right now it doesn't help that I have no one to go to to talk to about this
He helped me through so much and I wasn't able to help him

I feel a million times more alone 

Sad thing is before I knew why he disappeared 
I still became depressed myself
And am struggling with these thoughts as well
And now even more so
